comment.text: I get the hype now. Everything was delicious. As this was very impromptu, we waited 40 minutes to sit at the bar on a Saturday and the service and ambiance were fantastic nonetheless. Lobster fritters, Caesar salad (fantastic Caesar), tartare, rack of lamb to share, and the cheesecake. Normally I'm like "yeah it's a steakhouse..." about steakhouses but this was notable.

This steakhouse was absolutely delicious. I loved how great the food was but it wasn't too stuffy but you also felt ok to dress up!  Good for a date night, business dinner, celebration or just wanting to treat yourself for a fabulous meal! Try the jalapeño creamed corn!

Kevin Rathbun's is a hidden gem inside the Atlanta beltine.  It sits down the hill from the restaurant Ladybird and can be missed if you've never dined there or not paying attention.  But let's not dwell on that part because that's nothing compared to the dining experience.  

My friends and I started our dinner experience with cocktails but since Covid-19 hit the drink menu isn't available on their online menu so I cannot refer to it for the name.  But please refer to the picture because it looks just like it tasted.  Sparkling, crisp, and floral.  It was such a refreshing drink that I ordered three...truly delightful.  

As for the food, I ordered the Pan Roasted Salmon.  It was good medium and with every bite you could taste the delicious combinations of the soy cherry sauce along with the fresh cooked vegetables, seasoned to perfection.  Along with this dish, I ordered the Charred Jalapeño Corn.  It added a sweet heat kick to the rest of the meal.  A hint of sweet from the creamy corn and heat from the jalapeño and it was a combination that took my meal to the next level.  

Kevin Rathbun Steak is a great place to have an intimate dinner with a date, quiet business dinner to impress a client, or just a place to connect with your friends.  The atmosphere, drinks, and entrees all make for an excellent nightcap.

Best steaks in al the land. And pretty mich everything else is amazing too. Service is always impeccable. 

Lobster fritters, short rib, and thick bacon all great starters. 

We love all the salads and can go full or halfsies. You can share a steak for 2 or even 3. And scallops are a great seafood option. 

Aways eat the bread. And the mushroom and lobster Mac and cheese are must have sides. 

During covid seating is space out, masks and gloves are on, and menus are paper.

I love the area that this place is in. It's such a quaint, live/work/play neighborhood. Valet and plenty of party. Patio and inside dining. I went with a few friends. Our waiter, Andrew was amazing. He was very knowledgeable and offered recommendations. I enjoyed bacon as an appetizer.  It was really like pork belly. Very tasty. For the main course, I had a NY strip steak. It was very savory. The jalapeño cream corn is so very tasty. 
The ambience of the space was great for date night or just hanging with friends. The decor is nice. I will definitely return. Staff very friendly and engaging. All staff wore masks and patrons must as well when walking through restaurant.

This was hands down the best dining experience of my life. My girlfriend and I came here for a nice date and it didn't disappoint. Tony was our server and every single recommendation he made was spot on. Definitely the best service we have ever received. The sommelier helped us pick a bottle of wine that fit our tastes and she absolutely nailed it, the wine was incredible. We started with the eggplant fries and the tuna tartare, and both were fantastic. We had the Snake River Farms 16oz wagyu steak, Brussels sprouts, and creamed spinach for the entree which was all absolutely phenomenal, and the peanut butter banana cream pie was the best possible finisher. The ambiance was amazing as well, just an awesome experience here.

Sides were salt bombs. Entrees are good. They have 2 wines with the same name and they bring you the one that costs 125 more without clarifying. Spent $600 on dinner and left very underwhelmed. Service was good though. Still not worth the price. Not our first time here, but certainly the last.

I decided to come here for my Father's 60th birthday and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere and customer service was great. The people at the bar were awesome and the food was very well prepared. Do not come here if you are penny pinching. I'm not one to splurge this much on food but you only turn 60 one time
Everyone in our party ordered the wagyu rib cap.   It was as good as advertised and the service was top shelve as well.

I'm a steak guy.  A rare to medium rare ribeye steak guy.  I got the bbq wagu short rib for the appetizer and the 30 day, dry age cowboy with the truffle butter for my entrée, the jalapeño corn and a double loaded baked potato for my sides. The steak was a 9.1 out of 10.  Perfect temp.  The flavor was great.  You could taste the jalapeño flavor in the corn but there was no spice.  I was expecting just a little kick but it was full of flavor.  The potato was great!  The staff is excellent.  Very attentive. I drink a lot of water and cocktail with my meals and didn't have to wait a second for a sip. It was my birthday dinner so I got the bread pudding for free! It's a great place to eat and I'll probably be back.

Never been and came here for dinner. The wine is amazing, and the atmosphere is very laid back and in a nice intimate setting.  I suggest the Balsamic Glazed Wagyu Short Rib for the appetizer and the Ribeye for the main dish.

We booked the wrong Rathbun's.. though it was the steakhouse. Nonetheless, great service/waitress and wonderful food. Kind of pricey.. would be totally worth it if the atmosphere was a little nicer and the kitchen wasn't open.

The food is absolutely amazing I got a fillet Pittsburgh style with a blue cheese crust. We also got lobster and oysters that were just to die for I would recommend getting the seafood tower. I had an excellent iceberg salad and my constituents got another salad but the name of eludes me. everything was delicious though.  Not only are they known for their steaks they're also known for their seafood. I had the pleasure of tasting their salmon and it was delightful. 

The bar has everything, including my favorite, Chopin Vodka. We have many herbs and vegetables behind the bar and we're happy to create me a custom cocktail that was absolutely perfect. 
Vodka, soda, shot of simple syrup, muddled cucumber, and muddled basil. My favorite summer time drink

You are a know me by now, service service service 
This is an impeccable team of people in an impeccable atmosphere with impeccable food.
Spend the time spend the money come here enjoy yourself and leave truly satisfied every single time. They will deliver.

photos.caption: Filet Pittsburgh style with blue cheese crust  10/10 recommend
They're known for their seafood. Just get the tower ;)

comment.text: I have been going to Kevin Rathbun's restaurants for a long time and they never disappoint!  I recently visited Kevin Rathbun Steak and it was amazing.  From the moment we walked in, the service was amazing.  Our main server, Tony, took amazing care of us and every dish he recommended was amazing.  Apps are delicious, steak cooked perfectly and all the sides compliment the main dishes.  I highly recommend this great spot right on the  beltline and I recommend asking for Tony as your server.
Service, food, and drinks are always amazing! Tony is the best! Whether inside or on the patio the ambiance is great!

Came here for Valentine's Day! It was a true joy. My date and I shared the lobster fritters. I ordered the filet mignon and he ordered the ribeye. We shared the Mac and cheese, creamed spinach and twice baked potato. The lobster fritters were light and airy. They came in a honey mustard sauce. The filet was DELICIOUS! Cooked perfectly medium rare to my liking. I ordered butter with it which was a great topping. The steak was so juicy and tender, the flavors were so divine. It was sizzling on the plate when served. For the sides: 
Mac and cheese: pretty basic, standard Mac & cheese 
Twice baked potato: very buttery
Creamed spinach: my personal favorite of the sides
Classic steakhouse side dish in a rich, cheesy cream sauce. 
Service was impeccable, servers are coming around routinely to replenish water and clean tables. The ambiance is very romantic and elegant. I had such a pleasant experience here and would highly recommend. Definitely make reservations ahead of time if you do go.

Wow this was the most amazing meal, ambiance, service, that I have ever had this decade!! I don't even know where to start my goodness.

Our server Andrew was so kind and helpful. He gave us excellent service and he made a lot of really great suggestions on what we should order.

I started with the Full Monty- such tender lobster, crab, and shrimp. Wow! Succulent is the word that comes to mind. The oysters were also fresh.

I had the filet mignon with truffle butter and we shared sides of the Mac and cheese, creamed spinach, risotto, and mashed potatoes. Everything was amazing. I can't say enough positive things about this place I will certainly be back!

We dined there with a very large group and I usually dread the service and wait times between courses with large groups, but they were on it. Our servers did a great job of keeping up with customer needs and wine, beer, and other beverages. The food was excellent and the food was outstanding.
I will dine here often when in Atlanta.
Best steakhouse in Atlanta! We had such a nice experience here! The service and the food were great. It wasn't as expensive as we thought it would be. The ambiance is luxury yet chill!
Great atmosphere and service and good food! The thick cut bacon appetizer was the perfect choice to open a great steak and seafood meal experience.
Delicious food and drinks. Menu pricey compared to a lot of high end restaurants nearby. But we were very satisfied with the everything.
Completely overpriced. The steaks at Capital Grille are much better quality and even the seasoning is very average.. side plates are small portions.

Kevin Rathbun's has always been our favorite spot for dinner, but they really delivered this month when we held a private event for my husband's birthday. We ate in the wine cellar, which was beautifully decorated, and the staff could not have been more accommodating. Every dish was delicious, and we especially enjoyed the Thick Cut Bacon, Caesar, Filet, Scalloped Sweet Potatoes, Truffle Mac & Cheese, and the Broccoli Rabe (basically the whole meal). Special shout-out to Ron & Sidney who went above and beyond to host us. Thank you KR's for an amazing experience and memorable night!

photos.caption: Filet mignon, sweet potato au gratin, mac & cheese

comment.text: Made reservations for a Friday night to celebrate my sisters birthday. This was my first visit but it's a favorite of hers, so I had high expectations. The service was amazing. The food was almost perfect. I wanted to try the "twice baked" baked potato but they were out. I ordered the mashed potatoes instead. They tasted good but they were a tad bit salty! Everything else tasted great. I especially loved the lobster fritters. 4.5/5

photos.caption: Jalapeño Creamed Corn and Mashed Potatoes

comment.text:
We visited Kevin Rathbun during restaurant week this year. I had never been here so I was excited for the opportunity to try it at a slightly less expensive price point. The regular menu options were available but we both opted to do the restaurant week. This is a 3 course meal for $40. You pick 1 appetizer, main, and dessert each. 

Drinks (not included): I forget the name but we got what was equivalent to an Old Fashion. $12 each, beer was $7. Old Fashions are my go to drinks and I thought they did a pretty good job making it. The beer wasn't really worth it in my opinion.

Appetizers: Grilled Baby Octopus & KRS Wagyu Short Rib Yakitori.They were both sooo good! The short rib was my favorite. We were told that it was smoked for over 8 hours! No wonder it was so tender. hmmmm yum.

Main: 6oz filet mignon & Smoked Pork Tenderloin. I prefer the tenderloin over the filet but that's just because I'm not big on eating beef. 

We also got an additional side ($9) to supplement our meals, but it wasn't really worth it. The scallop sweet potatoes were nice, but not that nice. Plus, it was kind of salty. 

Dessert: Creme caramel with fresh berries (it's really just a flan) & Chocolate ganache cake. The cake was slightly bitter but complemented the flan very well. Sweet vs. bitter.

Overall, I recommend coming here on a special occasion, during restaurant week to try it out, or just when you feel like splurging. Service was excellent as well. Our server, Rick, was very attentive and professional.

Cool place, very hip. Quality atmosphere and vibe for making a good impression on that crucial first date. Valet parking, top-notch service.

The appetizers and sides are plentiful, we had the thick bacon and lobster rolls along with the scalloped potatoes, onion rings, jalapeno corn and shrooms. Everything was outstanding and the wine parings were perfect.

The steaks are humongous. We split a bone-in, dry-aged cowboy for 2 that arrived already cut into bite sized pieces. It was good, not great. Really expected a juicier, tastier steak.

$360 for an excellent night and new experience is a good deal for me, we enjoyed ourselves, just not sure about the value given the other local options for far less. We will try again, it is a wonderful place.

Enjoyed an amazing dinner with with work colleagues on 11/8/22. We ate outside and the ambience was great. The lobster fritters appetizer were incredible and a must have! The Spinalis steak was done and seasoned to perfection. Sydney was very attentive and a great server. Will definitely be back!
Great food and atmosphere, service was spot on . Tony our server was awesome  oysters were a little small . But everything else was delicious .
Dear Rathbun's, I will be back.  yummy! Great service and top quality food! Amazing evening! Thank you

photos.caption: Ribeye with blue cheese crumbles and black truffle butter on side.
Half eaten lobster fritters. The lobster was soooo tender and batter crunchy! Another must have!
Sweet potato Gruyère side .. A MUST have! And yummy onion rings!

comment.text:
We came here for a friend's birthday and we were not disappointed. From the beginning to the end, the service and the food was excellent. We ordered a round of drinks which were prepared very well. For my Yelp drinkers...the bartender made the drinks super strong!  We ordered several appetizers once we learned they were shareable. All of them were great. My least favorite was the sweet potato one. It wasn't sweet.  We ordered burgers and steak and we ate every last bite. The burgers while served separate of any side were double patties and huge. It was worth the $21. 

The ambiance is very sexy, fun, and romantic. It's ideal for a small intimate group. We were seated in a round sectional and it was perfect for our party of 4.

I'll definitely return!!!

Second time having client dinner at Rathbun Steak. Probably would have rated 3.5 stars if option was available. Seating at high top in bar area is the way to go. Filet was ok; tender, good flavor but prefer steaks that are served hot. Wouldn't say it was cold (cooked medium) but was just an ok filet. The short rib appetizer was phenomenal and wine selection is expansive, even by the glass. The beef carpaccio lacked flavor. Pork belly (bacon) appetizer was pretty good. Bill was over $200/person with tax and tip for three of us.

Not the best steak I've ever had. The saving grace are the outdoor tables next to the belt line. My party of 9 loved this aspect of the restaurant as you can watch all walks of life while you dine. I got the 10oz ribeye for $44 and was unimpressed. The table split a variety of sides including asparagus, lobster fritters, fries all were good. The ribeye looked like a larger ribeye that had been cut in half. The flavor was not memorable. The service was great!

When you want the best steak in Atlanta you come here. Kevin's is my favorite restaurant in town, and they always deliver. Make sure to get the Wedge Salad, Wagu short rib, dry aged steak for two (rare plus), scalloped sweet potatoes, and that creamed corn! Bar tenders do an amazing job. For you martini lovers they have blue cheese stuffed olives!

This is a beautiful space, and the service is unbelievable. My boyfriend and I split the steak for two for $108. It was amazing but if I went back I'd probably just prefer a filet for myself. 

The wagyu beef carpaccio was excellent and we got a side of Mac and cheese too. Sides are family style - the Mac and cheese hit the spot for both of me and my boyfriend, and we normally disagree on Mac and cheese.

photos.caption: Steak for two and Mac and cheese
Glass of wine on the front lawn before our reservation. Seating and fire pits

comment.text:
If you want to place to take Instagram photos that you can tag where you overpaid for a terrible food and service  experience than this is the place for you.

The other day I visited with three friends, not having been there for a few years, I was utterly disappointed. I am no stranger to find dining in Atlanta, but people like Kevin Rathburn need to meet the expectations of their guests, although without a doubt, he can sleep easy knowing that 90% of people will not complain, or even notice where his establishment falls short as they continue to eat from the troth. One thing I like about traveling outside the US is restauranteurs and chefs actually take pride in their work. But not Ruthbun.  10% of people, read a menu and have expectations for what they are about order and pay for (that is if they can even get their order in). 

The service was horrendous. I recognized the server,  a well spoken older African American gentlemen, one that's been there for a very long time. To say he had a chip on his shoulder is an understatement; But alas good help is hard to find these days. It took us 30 minutes to get our first drink order in. We tried to order appetizers at the same time but the server told us he would be right back, and we saw him 15 or 20 minutes later. 

The $eafood tower appetizer, was not a tower at all, it was a plate. A few oysters, a couple of lobster claws and a few other bits and pieces is not gonna cut it. The guests ordered and expected a tower. We let the server know,  Who quickly reminded us of how much seafood prices have gone up. All of us read the news, we know supply chain and prices are up, we don't need excuses, we expected a tower, so remove the word tower off your menu!

After the starters were served we waited again to place are entree order, and after flagging down another server we had ours return. After placing our order, and needing to order wine we found out that our server had gone home for the evening and we have been transferred to a new person.

We did order 4 steaks, and 4 sides.
The steaks were good, cooked correctly to temperature and nicely served.
The four sides arrived completely cold. ALL FOUR!
We ordered a nice bottle of wine for the table, and we had it in put in a decanter. 
All in all, we enjoyed the steak and wine, but the rest of the experience was dreadful.
Can say we will be back anytime soon.
Great place to have a very nice dinner. Always great meals with great service! Can never go wrong by crossing to have a meal here!

I came in with high expectations which can be the kiss of death. In this case it was. We had to wait forever between courses. The bacon was good as was the chopped salad and bread. Yet we were there the first the  steak. When our steak finally did come out we found it to be fairly tasteless and lukewarm. The onion rings were overly salty and not flavorful either. All and all it was adequate but when spending $200 I want it to be amazing.
This is one of our frequent dining options every month. I love this place for a number of reason - the food is delicious, the service is exceptional, and the drinks are cold!

Wow this steakhouse is amazing. The ambience was great. For drinks we split a bottle of Cote du Py. We ordered the Burratta, Caesar salad, and mixed salad for our first course. For the main course, I ordered the filet with scallops, and the filet was cooked perfectly. For sides, we had the truffle fries, mushrooms, mushroom risotto, and asparagus. Prices are obviously a bit expensive, but definitely recommend for a special occasion!

Excellent service, I am disabled and needed to use the ladies room, our waiter( male) held my arm and walked me and when I was done a female waitress was there to help me back to my seat. I thought they went over and beyond in customer service

As good as it gets for a steakhouse. Service was friendly, the ambiance is terrific, and the food was perfect.
We were celebrating a special occasion with friends and everything was spot on. The drinks (Old Irv, Just Peachy, and Bluebell were the highlights), the food - porterhouse, mushrooms, o-rings and spinach salad were carefully prepared and served.
Even the desserts - creme brûlée and dacquoise - were remarkable.
Overall, a fantastic experience, highly recommended for anyone looking for a special place for a great meal in the city.

My dining experience was exceptional 
I know it's a steakhouse ( Not a beef eater) 
They do have a few seafood options which turned out to be very good 
The service was excellent
The drinks were excellent 
And that cheesecake dessert was to die for 
I will be returning

user.name: Evelyn M.
user.address: Mid City South, Baton Rouge, LA

comment.text: Went here for my birthday and I absolutely fell in love! The lobster fritters were a delicious appetizer with the perfect ratio of lobster and breading. I had the Pink Cadillac cocktail and it was tasty as well.

The best steak in Georgia hands down, side dishes are amazing along with the appetizers-definitely try the marrow-excellent.  The wage steak melts in your mouth and the T-Bone is to die for.  Desserts are awesome and the service was excellent, I recommend this place to anyone traveling to Atlanta
Incredible food and above and beyond service. We will definitely be back. A true treat! We enjoyed lobster, steak, wine, dessert!

Liked + Liked + Liked + Liked + Liked + Liked + Liked + Liked + Liked  

Atmosphere and Ambiance 

Service - I loved there was a team to care for us during our dinner, they worked together well and were attentive and quick. 

Mussels - delicious, a little spicy, so nice kick. 

Lobster Fritter - very meaty, it was fried perfectly. 

Salmon - The skin was so crispy and great texture. Cooked very well. 

Broccolini - I liked that it was spicy, cooked crisply and had great flavor. 

Even though our party went late, they did not rush us. I appreciate they allowed us to celebrate my cousin's birthday a little later than usual. 


Disliked - Disliked - Disliked  - Disliked  - Disliked  - Disliked  - Disliked 

Scallops: I wasn't crazy about the preparation of the scallops or the veggie and sauce that accompanies it. The flavor wasn't pleasant. But the flavor on the scallops had seasoning. I didn't care for the texture of the Roasted Scallop. 

6 oz Filet: The temperature was good however I didn't taste any real flavor. I don't think the steak was salted. I didn't want sauces or anything extra I was just wanting a good steak. I wasn't upset, I was just a bit shocked to find I was not impressed. 

Risotto - The Mushroom was good, but the risotto texture didn't seem cooked correctly.

I am not too familiar with Atlanta; however, after dining at KEVIN Rathbun Steak I can say without hesitation that I've experienced the best of Atlanta! From the moment I stepped thru their front door I was greeted with arms wide open smiles by the staff and an aromatic ambience that reminded me of outdoor cooking at my grandparents in Arkansas with hickory chips my grandfather had just cut from a tree on their land! 
It's taken me a few days to write this review because I can't seem to find prolific words to describe the experience. Our waiter, Rick, had to be one of the most attentive and skilled waiters in the business. He has a strong sense of discernment and reads you well. And we women are crazy because we can be famished yet so indecisive about our choices. Problem solved! My Spicy Margarita(ATF) was unlike any other and our appetizer was decadent yet savory and the beef literally melted in your mouth like warm butter on a hot pancake. The eggplant fries come with a sauce made of Tabasco and powdered sugar!!!! DONT KNOCK IT ~TIL YOU TRY IT!!!Every flavor has been carefully prepared to maximize the pleasure centers of ALL of your taste buds! If you're reading this review then this should be your last read. STOP  Pick up the phone or go online now and make that reservation. Look no further. The story behind the Chef KEVIN Rathbun is one that will touch each and everyone because his passion for his craft and compassion for his staff is unique and inspiring and Lord knows we could all use more of that in our lives. The presentation is a perfectly woven tapestry that you get to walk away with and share with others like I'm doing right now with you! Thank you Rick! You're truly the best ever and thank you for making my evening a defining culinary experience I will surely never forget!

This place was okay. Didn't hate here but wasn't in love. I loved the drinks and the ambiance here and the Japanese wagyu short rib tips are a hit! But the food itself was very bland. They charge $12 for broccoli with a slice of American cheese on top. The steak was okay. Not the worst steak but definitely not the best. The sides were meh. I probably wouldn't come back here willingly.

What beautiful indoor aesthetic. The bar is just dark enough and welcoming. Outdoor seating looked lovely too. Irv the bartender-he is the best! No nonsense, personable, informative,and gave really great suggestions. I had a whiskey based drink that featured K. Rathbun's whiskey. I'm generally not a brown liquor drinker, but I wanted a full Rathbun experience. It was smooth, balanced, and let the simple ingredients do the talking. After discussing with Irv- I decided to have tuna tartare for my appetizer and steak tartare appetizer as my dinner. Why? Because I generally order a tuna tartare if it's on the menu AND Irv couldn't say enough good things about it. I got the steak tartare because it features a cut of steak I don't see everywhere (spinalis). Albeit raw, this way I got to try Rathbun's seafood and steak without getting too full. Irv mentioned the creamed corn as being a staple side at Rathbuns- I knew I wouldn't finish it, but wanted to try. Irv informed me they can halve sides! So it was a no brainer. Ended up being too much food for me, but the cleanest plate of them all was the tuna tartare!! This is one of-if not-the best tuna tartare I've had. Fresh fish. Crispy puffed cracker/pappard type accoutrement was needed and welcomed. There was a freshness while still offering an umami. Wasabi essence was present in every bite without it being overwhelming. I would come back here just for this tuna tartare. A person at the bar asked me what I ordered (I suppose people get curious when your eyes are rolling Yo the back of your head with every bite). I told them and they said it sounded good, but they don't like raw fish-I knew then we couldn't be friends. The spinalis tartare. Happy to finally try this fatty, tender, non-grisly meat. I really got to see it naked by trying it raw. It was not covered by, but enhanced by, the usual tartare ingredients (capers et al). This tartare came with botarga and fish eggs on the plate. This "fishyness" with certain bites of the tartare I did not like so much. I avoided those items, and the tartare with the accompanying Sardinian crackers was sublime. The creamed corn was not too creamy, fresh sweet corn, and a little kick. If you like corn- try this. Corn isn't my favorite unless it's in the form of a tortilla...so I'm admittedly not the best judge. Bread service was two perfectly sized pieces of focaccia. It's worth trying. Served warm. Welcomed while drinking a string, balanced, tasty whiskey beverage. If I were to return again today (I fear I might-the tuna tartare has me whipped!) I'd get the tuna tartare and a drink that Irv suggests. You really should come to Kevin Rathbun's steakhouse . I truly don't think you'll be disappointed.

I've been to Kevin Rathbun's Steakhouse multiple times and am never disappointed. The service is always top notch and the food is incredible. I've never been here and left without being utterly satisfied by my experience. This is definitely a place to go to for any special occasion or when you just want a nice steak and appetizers!
